title: Why twisted gold jewellery is the ultimate new statement
text:
The late, great Greek goldsmith Ilias Lalaounis was passionate about reviving Ancient Greek goldsmithing techniques and infusing his work with historical symbols. Endless iterations of the Greek-key motif are present in his creations, which can now be found at auction and in his eponymous museum in Athens. The repeating motif was originally inspired by the Maeander river of Ancient Greece, now in modern Turkey, and it's from where the word meander derives, meaning to twist and turn.
